column1: The Embassy of the United States in Wellington
column2: New Zealand along with the consulate general in Auckland provides assistance to American citizens and issues travel visas to foreign nationals who wish to visit the United States.

column1: There have been many United States Ambassadors to New Zealand since the post was created on 12 October 1838.  The current U.S. Ambassador is Scott Brown
column2: who was confirmed to the post on 8 June 2017.

column1: The Embassy is located in the inner-city Wellington suburb of Thorndon
column2: a 10-minute walk away from Parliament. The embassy is bounded by Fitzherbert Terrace to the north
column4: and Halswell Street to the south
column5: and the private girls' school Queen Margaret College to the east.
